allOf.title: browserSite

allowRedirect.description: Controls the behavior of redirected sites. If true, indicates that the site will open in Internet Explorer 11 or Microsoft Edge even if the site is navigated to as part of a HTTP or meta refresh redirection chain.

createdDateTime.description: The date and time when the site was created.

deletedDateTime.description: The date and time when the site was deleted.

history.description: The history of modifications applied to the site.

lastModifiedDateTime.description: The date and time when the site was last modified.

allOf.description: Singleton entity which is used to specify IE mode site metadata

comment.description: The comment for the shared cookie.

createdDateTime.description: The date and time when the shared cookie was created.

deletedDateTime.description: The date and time when the shared cookie was deleted.

history.description: The history of modifications applied to the cookie.

hostOnly.description: Controls whether a cookie is a host-only or domain cookie.

lastModifiedDateTime.description: The date and time when the cookie was last modified.

allOf.title: browserSiteList

description.description: The description of the site list.

displayName.description: The name of the site list.

lastModifiedDateTime.description: The date and time when the site list was last modified.

publishedDateTime.description: The date and time when the site list was published.

revision.description: The current revision of the site list.

sharedCookies.description: A collection of shared cookies defined for the site list.

sites.description: A collection of sites defined for the site list.

allOf.description: A singleton entity which is used to specify IE mode site list metadata

deploymentAudiences.description: The set of updatableAsset resources to which a deployment can apply.

resourceConnections.description: Service connections to external resources such as analytics workspaces.

updatableAssets.description: Assets registered with Windows Autopatch that can receive updates.

updatePolicies.description: A collection of policies for approving the deployment of different content to an audience over time.

entries.description: Lists the content that you can approve for deployment. Read-only.

deployableUntilDateTime.description: The date on which the content is no longer available to deploy. The Timestamp type represents date and time information using ISO 8601 format and is always in UTC time. For example, midnight UTC on Jan 1, 2014 is 2014-01-01T00:00:00Z. Read-only.

displayName.description: The display name of the content. Read-only.

releaseDateTime.description: The release date for the content. The Timestamp type represents date and time information using ISO 8601 format and is always in UTC time. For example, midnight UTC on Jan 1, 2014 is 2014-01-01T00:00:00Z. Read-only.

applicableContent.description: Content eligible to deploy to devices in the audience. Not nullable. Read-only.

exclusions.description: Specifies the assets to exclude from the audience.

members.description: Specifies the assets to include in the audience.

catalogEntryId.description: ID of the catalog entry for the applicable content.

matchedDevices.description: Collection of devices and recommendations for applicable catalog content.

deviceId.description: Collection of vendors who recommend the content.

recommendedBy.description: Collection of vendors who recommend the content.

createdDateTime.description: The date and time the deployment was created. Returned by default. Read-only.

lastModifiedDateTime.description: The date and time the deployment was last modified. Returned by default. Read-only.

friendlyNames.description: The friendly names of the product. For example, Version 22H2 (OS build 22621). Read-only.

groupName.description: The name of the product group. For example, Windows 11. Read-only.

name.description: The name of the product. For example, Windows 11, version 22H2. Read-only.

editions.description: Represents an edition of a particular Windows product.

knownIssues.description: Represents a known issue related to a Windows product.

deviceFamily.description: The device family targeted by the edition.

endOfServiceDateTime.description: The date and time when the edition reached the end of service. The timestamp type represents date and time information using ISO 8601 format and is always in UTC. For example, midnight UTC on Jan 1, 2014 is 2014-01-01T00:00:00Z. Read-only.

generalAvailabilityDateTime.description: The date and time when the edition became available to the general customers for the first time. The timestamp type represents date and time information using ISO 8601 format and is always in UTC. For example, midnight UTC on Jan 1, 2014 is 2014-01-01T00:00:00Z. Read-only.

isInService.description: Indicates whether the edition is in service or out of service.

name.description: The name of the edition. Read-only.

releasedName.description: The public name of the edition. Read-only.

description.description: The description of the particular known issue.

lastUpdatedDateTime.description: The date and time when the known issue was last updated. The timestamp type represents date and time information using ISO 8601 format and is always in UTC. For example, midnight UTC on Jan 1, 2014 is 2014-01-01T00:00:00Z. Read-only.

resolvedDateTime.description: The date and time when the known issue was resolved or mitigated. The timestamp type represents date and time information using ISO 8601 format and is always in UTC. For example, midnight UTC on Jan 1, 2014 is 2014-01-01T00:00:00Z.

startDateTime.description: The date and time when the known issue was first reported. The timestamp type represents date and time information using ISO 8601 format and is always in UTC. For example, midnight UTC on Jan 1, 2014 is 2014-01-01T00:00:00Z.

title.description: The title of the known issue.

webViewUrl.description: The URL to the known issue in the Windows Release Health dashboard on Microsoft 365 admin center.

url.description: The URL of the knowledge base article. Read-only.

displayName.description: The display name of the content. Read-only.

product.description: The product of the revision. Possible values are: Windows 10, Windows 11. Read-only.

releaseDateTime.description: The release date for the content. The Timestamp type represents date and time information using ISO 8601 format and is always in UTC time. For example, midnight UTC on Jan 1, 2014 is 2014-01-01T00:00:00Z. Read-only.

version.description: The version of the feature update. Read-only.

complianceChangeRules.description: Rules for governing the automatic creation of compliance changes.

createdDateTime.description: The date and time when the update policy was created. The Timestamp type represents date and time information using ISO 8601 format and is always in UTC time. For example, midnight UTC on Jan 1, 2014 is 2014-01-01T00:00:00Z.

complianceChanges.description: Compliance changes like content approvals which result in the automatic creation of deployments using the audience and deploymentSettings of the policy.

createdDateTime.description: The date and time when a compliance change was created.

isRevoked.description: True indicates that a compliance change is revoked, preventing further application. Revoking a compliance change is a final action.

revokedDateTime.description: The date and time when the compliance change was revoked.

id.description: The unique identifier for an entity. Read-only.

reasons.description: Specifies the reasons the deployment has its state value. Read-only.

endDateTime.description: The date and time when the servicing period ends. The timestamp type represents date and time information using ISO 8601 format and is always in UTC. For example, midnight UTC on Jan 1, 2014 is 2014-01-01T00:00:00Z. Read-only.

name.description: The name of the servicing period. For example, Modern Lifecycle.

startDateTime.description: The start date and time of the servicing period. The timestamp type represents date and time information using ISO 8601 format and is always in UTC. For example, midnight UTC on Jan 1, 2014 is 2014-01-01T00:00:00Z. Read-only.

createdDateTime.description: The date and time when the post was created. The timestamp type represents date and time information using ISO 8601 format and is always in UTC. For example, midnight UTC on Jan 1, 2014 is 2014-01-01T00:00:00Z. Read-only.

buildNumber.description: The build number of the product release. Read-only.

majorVersion.description: The major version of the product release. Read-only.

minorVersion.description: The minor version of the product release. Read-only.

updateBuildRevision.description: The update build revision number of the product revision. Read-only.

createdDateTime.description: The date and time when the rule was created.

lastEvaluatedDateTime.description: The date and time when the rule was last evaluated.

lastModifiedDateTime.description: The date and time when the rule was last modified.

displayName.description: The display name of the identity. For drive items, the display name might not always be available or up to date. For example, if a user changes their display name the API might show the new value in a future response, but the items associated with the user don't show up as changed when using delta.

id.description: Unique identifier for the identity or actor. For example, in the access reviews decisions API, this property might record the id of the principal, that is, the group, user, or application that's subject to review.

offerWhileRecommendedBy.description: Offer if the update is recommended by a vendor in the list, otherwise withhold the offer.

isExpedited.description: True indicates that the deployment of the content is expedited.

isReadinessTest.description: True indicates that the deployment is an expedite readiness test.

monitoringRules.description: Specifies the rules through which monitoring signals can trigger actions on the deployment. Rules are combined using 'or.'

startDateTime.description: The date on which devices in the deployment start receiving the update. When not set, the deployment starts as soon as devices are assigned. The Timestamp type represents date and time information using ISO 8601 format and is always in UTC time. For example, midnight UTC on Jan 1, 2014 is 2014-01-01T00:00:00Z.

daysUntilForcedReboot.description: Specifies the number of days after an update is installed, during which the user of the device can control when the device restarts.

offerAsOptional.description: Specifies whether the update is offered as Optional rather than Required.

disabledSafeguardProfiles.description: List of safeguards to ignore per device.

threshold.description: The threshold for a signal at which to trigger the action. An integer from 1 to 100 (inclusive). This value is ignored when the signal is ineligible and the action is offerFallback.

durationBetweenOffers.description: The duration between each set of devices being offered the update. The value is represented in ISO 8601 format for duration. Default value is P1D (one day).

microsoft.graph.ODataErrors.InnerError.description: The structure of this object is service-specific

top.name: $top
top.description: Show only the first n items
